snippet: Mr. Smith, whose company flew military support missions during several wars, was known for his determination to preserve the Spruce Goose, the world’s largest flying boat, which remains an attraction at the Evergreen Aviation and Space Museum.
abstract: Delford Smith, who founded a major international aviation company but who may be most remembered for his determination to preserve the mammoth seaplane known as the Spruce Goose, built by Howard Hughes, dies at age 84.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Smith, whose company flew military support missions during several wars, was known for his determination to preserve the Spruce Goose, the world’s largest flying boat, which remains an attraction at the Evergreen Aviation and Space Museum.

headline.main: Delford Smith, Founder of Aviation Company, Dies at 84
headline.print_headline: Delford Smith, Founder of Aviation Company, 84
